meanings.definition: Showing a sharp or sour taste
meanings.sent1: The lemonade was the tartiest drink at the party.
meanings.sent2: The vinegar had the tartiest flavor of all the condiments.
meanings.sent3: She made a face after tasting the tartiest candy in the jar.
meanings.sent4: The tartiest apple in the orchard made her pucker with each bite.
meanings.sent5: The tartiest grapefruit she ever tried left a lasting impression on her taste buds.

meanings.sent1: Her tartiest remark cut through the tension in the room.
meanings.sent2: The critic's review had the tartiest critique of the entire show.
meanings.sent3: His tartiest comment left everyone speechless for a moment.
meanings.sent4: The tartiest knife in the set effortlessly sliced through the tough meat.
meanings.sent5: The tartiest wit in the group always kept everyone on their toes with clever comebacks.

meanings.definition: Excessively bold or daring in a way that is considered tasteless or inappropriate
meanings.sent1: Her outfit was the tartiest choice for the formal event.
meanings.sent2: His prank was the tartiest joke he had ever played on his friends.
meanings.sent3: The tartiest dance move at the party had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: The tartiest decision he made was to quit his job without a backup plan.
meanings.sent5: The tartiest proposal she received was to travel the world together after just one date.
